name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Latham

reviews.text: Everyone was very pleasant. Handicapped room was roomy and easy to get around in. Rooms were clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: My wife and infant son stayed as a free night from my Holiday Inn Rewards program. We had driven down from Montreal to fly back home from a 4 day trip. We were tired because the had driven 4 hrs and the accomodations in Montreal were less than comfortable. We opened the door to the Executive Building room and very, very pleased. The King sized bed was VERY comfortable, the spaciousness of the room was also a plus because my son loves to run around. We were never afraid that he would get hurt because it was SPACIOUS!! The hotel had a very nice breakfast the next day. I was dissapointed that the Indoor pool was closed, but maybe next time. The only dislikes that I had was the directions to get to the Hotel from I-87 S and the tub sized shower in the room that allowed water to get all over the bathroom floor while my wife was trying to bathe our son.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!!

reviews.text: The room was clean and large, with good lighting. Bathroom was also clean and large. I had no trouble sleeping on the big bed.
reviews.title: A REALLY GOOD WEEKEND STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people at the counter were very helpful and provided a speedy check-in. They also recognized me as a Platinum member.
reviews.title: Staff Very Friendly and Helpful - Nice Road Trip Stay

reviews.text: Very nice newer hotel, clean, convenient and close to many good restaurants. We suggest eating at Dakota's Steak House. The bed was very comfortable, the room and bath were large and very quiet. Good breakfast too! The front desk clerk was extremely nice and helpful.
reviews.title: possible bed bug

reviews.text: Clean, quiet, spacious. Like the addition of bar and restaurant. Only drawback is pool is over chlorinated. Will definitely stay again, asked for and was able to get a room in the back area
reviews.title: Perfect home away from home

reviews.text: The shower area needs updating but was clean.
reviews.title: Comfortable but not the cleanest
Ok in a pinch
reviews.text: The beds, noise level, room size were comfortable. Dirty towels, not enough towels, hair in shower and bathroom. Pool was dirty. Some equipment in excercise room was broken. Breakfast was fine. Looking for something cleaner for next trip. Pricey for what you get.

My wife and I have stayed at this particular Holiday Inn Express on two occassions this month consisting of one 3 night stay and one 4 night stay while I was on business. The hotel and rooms are generally clean although our shower curtain did show signs of mold at the bottom edge as did the tiles in the shower. The location is good and relatively close to shopping, restaurants and local transportation routes. The desk staff is generally friendly and helpful but not overwhelmingly outgoing. The room can be noisy from guests coming and going and local highway traffic. Currently there is no functioning business center for printing your boarding pass or other documents. The free breakfast is adequate with limited choices. The rooms do not have a microwave or refrigerator. The room attendant on our floor had a terrible case of body odor that lingered in the hallway. There is a restaurant next door but we did not eat there. Overall, I would say this particular Holiday Inn Express is not as good as others I have stayed in but it is adequate for short stays.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.text: This is a pleasantly updated and clean mid-budget hotel. Our room was spacious, clean, comfortable and attractive with good temperature control. The only odd omission is an exhaust fan in an otherwise pretty nice bathroom. The pillows were disappointing - this and the complementary breakfast are the reasons I gave it a 4. The breakfast is adequate if you want efficient fueling and a quick getaway, but if you're a breakfast lover this will not satisfy. No fresh fruit! Another strange omission... long story short, I'd stay here again when visiting family in the area, as there is a shortage of decent hotels that offer queen beds instead of double.
reviews.title: It was fine.

reviews.text: Do not stay here .
reviews.title: horrible

reviews.text: There are people picketing all night with bull horns
reviews.title: Supassed my expectations

reviews.text: The desk staff and the managers are rude
reviews.title: Like staying with the Munsters-A Horror!!!

reviews.text: had to call police twice to try to quiet down the picketers
reviews.title: Superb!!

reviews.text: I am a Siena grad (1990) and came to town to show my family where I went to school. We also went to the Saratoga Races and to Howe Caverns. The location was ideal for all three stops - it was very easy to get on and off the highway. The Jr. suite was the perfect size for a family of 4 and the price was great. The service was excellent - I needed directions to a restaurant and they happily looked them up and printed them out for me. The hotel was very clean which was very important since my in-laws were traveling with us. The breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Poor Managment
Nice hotel, but thin walls
reviews.text: The room was nice, bed was comfortable, and the front desk was very friendly. The breakfast was good too. My only complaint is that I could here the water running from the adjacent room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was great. The service, the staff, the room, the cleanliness, and yes, the free breakfast too. Everyone was extremely helpful and glad to be of service. Now that's refreshing!
reviews.title: Great price and excellent free breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Online reservations were all ready when we arrived. Front desk was pleasant and gave us great directions for morning breakfast and where rooms were located. Room was clean and bathroom spotless.
reviews.title: All I Could Ask For

reviews.text: As we entered or left the hotel the front desk always spoke to us. It was a special day(our sons 48th birthday). We traveled from MA to celebrate with him. Holiday Inn made it a great trip to remember.
reviews.title: Don't believe everything you read. This is a Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say I am a regular at this hotel. I stay here whenever I am in the area. I find this hotel being the best hotel in town and the newest. The staff is consistent and sincere, the management is always there, and it really feels like these people enjoy working together.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great price, great staff

reviews.text: We had a handicapped room which was nice but basic while our friend got an upgrade to a suite which had a couch and fridge and microwave, ours didn't. The bed was heavenly and sadly only sold for hospitality i.e. Hotels. The breakfast was good but not as extensive as some HIE's only serving sausage, eggs, variety of breads and the pancake machine still broken or appeared to be. No bacon or ham too, but still good. We ate at the sports bar and the food and service was very nice, it was a long walk thru the huge hotel to get there. The only real complaint was the pool was very cloudy you couldn't see the bottom when empty nor your feet. The wirlpool was moldy in the corners and around the top edges, very gross, the guy came out and sprayed the edges amd used a brush to scrub a bit off all while we were poolside watching him. What needs to be done is to drain completly and sanitize and de-mold, the foam that collects was a bit dirty too. A couple went in with a child in a swim diaper just before we went in.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with the best bed ever!!

reviews.text: This is a nice and fairly new property. The exterior is well maintained and has ample parking. The lobby is also very nice, as are all common areas.
reviews.title: It's a Shame About the Housekeeping

reviews.text: I was upgraded to a king suite, which while nothing more than a normal room with an area for a coutch, which was very nice and spacious. The room had a fridge and microwave, nice comforatable bed, flat screen TV, good wireless internet, etc. The bathroom is also spacious with a large vanity. AC unit was quiet, as were the hallways. There is also a decent sports bar style restaurant on the propoerty which is always nice if you don't feel like driving.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: This hotel has everything I look for in a place to spend a night. However, housekeeping and cleansliness of the room get a failing grade. Trash under the skirt around the bed; the fridge was still full of the last guests half eaten food; half finished cup of coffee sitting on the desk; the last guests used bar of soap left in the shower; someones eye glasses on the floor. The biggest one though is the black mold in the shower where the surround meets the tub.
reviews.title: Great value
Decent choice near Albany Airport
reviews.text: Its a real shame, as this is definetely a nice property, but I can't do dirty!

Typical Holiday Inn express although I found the service to be quite poor and the room really needed updating. The carpet was visibly very dirty. While I was recognized as a platinum member, it seemed very artificial.
reviews.title: So so - hotels needs updating

reviews.text: Stayed there for one night on my way back from Canada. Typical Holiday Inn that is either newly built or newly refurbished. The rooms are large and clean, the beds are comfortable and the wireless is super-fast. There is a little fitness room for those who want to work out. Breakfast is OK, a bit limited but more than enough for me. I experienced absolutely no problems at all and I would definetly stay here again if passing through. One reviewer claims they caught bedbugs here but there is absolutely no way this could be true, at least not from my experience. I should also note that I stupidly made a mistake with booking my reservation online (I put the wrong date in) and when I showed up late at night they could not find my booking. Anyway the the girl at the front desk was very helpful and did her utmost to find me a room for the same rate despite the hotel being quite busy. She was great !
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Very Helpful Staff

reviews.text: Stayed in Room 242, an "executive suite". The rugs, furniture & walls had black stains marks, the shower stall had mildew, the kitchenette had no cups or plates and....the furniture was covered with dust. Called downstairs for a setup for the pull-out couch and was provided one pillow and a crib sized blanket. For near $200.00 a night, I expected a clean room!!!! The icing on the cake....the "executive suites" are located right on top of the bar/outdoor smoking area so I got to listen to drunks yelling and screaming until 3:00 a.m.
reviews.title: Dirty, Loud & Unprofessional staff

reviews.text: I chose this hotel because I was going to the Saratoga Racetrack and couldn't afford the hotels in Saratoga itself. The Holiday Inn was conveniently off the Northway, maybe 1/4 mile from the exit ramp. Lots of parking, checkin was a snap. Got there at 8pm after the track closed, and found out I was upgraded to a handicapped suite. Very large room, wide bathroom. Maybe too much furniture, a chair and table set would have blocked hallway access for anyone in a wheelchair. The cable TV connection was a bit shaky, had to fiddle with the cable to minimize snowy reception. Bed and shower both comfortable. Refrigerator, microwave and sink in the room, nice.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: Holiday Inn offers a continental breakfast in a very large room near reception, great coffee, usual breakfast fare items offered, I liked the cinnamin bun.
reviews.title: Terrible Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: I was quite surprised that this was a HIE but also a highrise. I love being above noise. Sure the breakfasts are predictable (read that in another review of this property) but you really can make your own variety each day since the selection is good. Access to shopping, restaurants, the airport, and Albany are all great since the Northway is right there.
reviews.title: High Rise and High Praise

reviews.text: We have reserved Hampton Inn Albany Downtown hotel on the way from Canada to the U.S. It was the end of the Labor Day weekend and the hotel was hosting 3 weddings at the same time. We checked a room that was supposed to be quiet and found it outdated, unattractive with view of a parking lot and noisy establishments. So, we decided to cancel the reservation and look around for something more suitable.
reviews.title: unexpected value and quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Holiday Inn Express in Latham was a great find. Off the main road but in the quiet corner, the hotel is brand new and well maintained. Front desk employee was very friendly and found us a room on the top floor which exactly fit our expectations. The beds were comfortable, sheets clean, pillows soft and carpets clean. Bathroom was a good size with all expected amenities. The only nuisance was incorrectly set flat screen TV with a bit unclear picture.
reviews.title: Will not stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Morning breakfast was very efficient and satisfactory. We would definitely stay here again once in the area as it was good quality and very economical.
reviews.title: Top Of The Line Holiday Inn Express
Great for an overnight stay before a flight out of Albany
reviews.text: I have stayed at a lot of Holiday Inn Express, but we will never stay at this one again. We stayed (2) nights and the Breakfast did not change and because we were on our Motorcycle and it was pouring rain, we ate at the reastaurant, On Tap, because of all the functions they had going on, the main dining, was closed to patrons, we and other patrons complained about the service. It took us 25 Minutes to get service, after asking for it twice. The people on the side of us, had waited over an hour for their food and there was so much confusion, we ended up with (2) servers who were arguing over who had our table. I finally stated that we DID NOT CARE WHO SERVED US, we just wanted to make the POOL before closing @ 11pm, and it was approximately (1) hour and (3/4) before we got out of a reastaurant that was not busy, with (3) waiters(waitresses) and a Bartender. It also took approximately 20 min. and a walk to the server to get our drink order, of just (2) coke.

If doing business in this part of Latham, this is a great hotel for the price point. Rooms are very spacious. Quick check in and plenty of parking. Nice gym area. Also, there is a restaurant & sports bar on site called On Tap, which is very convenient, as there arent a lot of other places close by. Good breakfast buffet in the AM at the hotel lounge.
reviews.title: Great business hotel!

reviews.text: We had to make a quick decision for a place to stay close to family for an unexpected funeral. Not knowing anything about the area we chose this location based strictly on the miles to drive to and from.
reviews.title: Great place to rest your weary bones

reviews.text: The shuttle picked us up at the aiport when we arrived. The driver was very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: We had a nice large, clean room with 2 beds and a sofa area. Microwave, small fridge and coffee pot.
reviews.title: Good hotel, however opportunities for improvement.

reviews.text: Breakfast had a large selection of fruit, hot and cold choices. Lots to chose from. Clean, staff constantly moving around cleaning tables and making sure the selections were fresh and full.
reviews.title: Great service, an owner that really cares.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Latham
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites in Latham, NY near Albany International Airport! Our choice Latham, NY accommodations are ideally located off I-87, just ten miles from downtown Albany and near many businesses and government offices. Travelers looking for lodging in Latham can enjoy a stay at our smoke free hotel near the Albany Airport, four universities and the famous Saratoga Race Course. Families will love our Latham hotel's close proximity to area attractions like the Empire State Plaza, Aqua Duck Tours, NY State Museum and Hoffman's Playland, a family-friendly theme park located two miles from our accommodations in Latham. If shopping is your pleasure, check out the Colonie Center Mall or the huge Crossgate Mall in Albany near our hotel in Latham, New York. There are many companies near our hotel in Latham, like Century Hill, SUNY Albany, Siena College and the New York State government offices. Business travelers can also appreciate the hotel's free airport shuttle to nearby ALB Airport. Our Latham, New York hotel also offers many hotel services, including a 24-hour business center, free high-speed, Wi-Fi Internet access and flexible meeting spaces with seating for 150. While lodging in Latham, you can take a dip in the indoor pool and whirlpool or take advantage of the 24-hour fitness center and complimentary hot breakfast bar. Check out our great Latham hotel room deals and start planning your trip today.
